name: Radisson Blu Hotel Tallinn

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as part of a hectic four-day three capital conference tour of the Balkans. One of the tallest blocks in the city, this modern hotel has all one expects of Radisson. We were given a business class room on the 22nd floor but asked to change to one with a bathroom which was no problem but took a long while to get. Once in it was very comfortable. There was wireless internet access throughout the hotel but as we didn't have a laptop we were able to use the business centre to check emails. The food was excellent particularly the breakfast.There is a bar in the large and attractive atrium entrance which always seemed busy and buzzy.
reviews.title: Towering over Tallin

reviews.text: The hotel is a short walk (10 mins) from the old town and you pass a large department store on the way which is an interesting contrast to the beautiful buildings of the old town. The Estonians are not naturally outgoing people so service can appear a bit surley but that's just their way. There are amber shops everywhere but it's the linen that is a really good buy.
reviews.title: Radisson - Oct30-Nov4

reviews.text: the 2 times i've stayed at the radisson i've found the hotel to be excellent. i stayed for 13 days in feb 05 and then 5 nights in oct / nov 05.
reviews.title: good hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious, quiet and spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast also is excellent.
reviews.title: Good central hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Radisson is a perfect 10 minute walk from the Old Town - close enough to enjoy this World Heritage Site but far enough away to avoid late night noise.
reviews.title: Another great Radisson experience

reviews.text: What's unique about this particular hotel is Lounge 24 - a rooftop bar with an outside terrace giving the most stunning views of the Old Town and Port. An absolute must at sunset.
reviews.title: Good, but could be better

reviews.text: Like all Radisson's I've stayed in the rooms are a generous size, and the bathrooms well-designed. The service is efficient and friendly, if a little reserved. But not everyone here speaks perfect English - and why should they?
reviews.title: tallinn revisited
Very nice hotel
reviews.text: SAS Radisson may be the best or one of the 2-3 best available choices in Tallinn, but this does not mean that it is really a top hotel. I used a business room, which was more spacious, had better view and more amenities than a standard room (incl. bathrobe and slippers). The hotel is quite new and the bathroom nice, but it's obvious that the hotel itself does not want to offer anything beyond the 4-star service. They are supposed to offer evening cleaning service, but their standard of cleaning service in the morning is quite low: they do not empty the trash every day (only every second day), they do not change used towels and they do not even touch the towel rug on the floor (they leave it there!). Even in the "business" rooms the supposedly rich amenities do not include sewing kit, body milk, conditioner, nail kit or cotton and cotton tubs. The carpet is clean, but of poor quality, while room temperature could not be adjusted. Furthermore, electricity was provided by the cardkey (following a policy of many resort hotels, but not business city hotels that claim to be 5star). Regarding their breakfast, it was not of a 5star quality, as there was no warm bread-like thing (you could only toast your bread,, but the rest was not really fresh)anywhere and no croissants. Their service at the restaurant (used also as breakfast room) was poor, they did not offer to do but only the absolutely necessary and smiles were literally inexistent. Their standard lunch buffet was poor and they had a strange policy of having water pre-served in the glasses and left on the table before customers' seating (that obviously saves them time!). In general, they never go out of their way to help you. All their 3 salads on their standard lunch buffet were around seafood -- no really vegetarian salad, which was very difficult for me who am allergic to seafood!

reviews.title: Very comfortable
reviews.text: And one more tip regarding this hotel: They price in Euro and send confirmation of prices in Euro, but when it comes to payment, they ask for 10% more if currency other than Kroon (their local currency) is used. They say that they have legitimate reason for that, as Euro or Dollars are not their currency, but then why do they confirm prices in Euro? On the one hand they hedge their pricing against risk of their currency's devaluation and on the other they use that way to bring you in a situation of having to pay the 10%extra when you have no possibility to go out to exchange when you check out (when it's possibly no banking hour or have no time). My reason to recommend this hotel would only be the fact that you can hardly find something better in Tallinn and that it is not far from the old town (10 minutes walk). But there is nothing to recommend in their services, and their prices are quite high; if one considers the country's price level (which is relatively low) and their level of service, the prices look rather excessive.

The Radisson SAS Tallinn is a modern and well staffed hotel. The rooms were spacious and had amazing views of the old town. Ice makers on every floor as well as irons/ironing boards in the room. The roof top bar was a great place to close out the night with a beer, albeit the service is slow at times due to the crowds. You can't beat the view from the outdoor section of the bar. The lobby bar was ok. Breakfast buffet had a great selection. This hotel is in walking distance to the old town.
reviews.title: Great Modern Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights on a visit to Tallinn. Chose it based on reviews from Tripadvisor describing amenities/location/etc. Admittedly, except for a few hiccups, I went away quite happy.
reviews.title: Satisfactory.

likes.liked: — The service/staff, definitely a pleasant surprise in Eastern Europe

reviews.text: Hotel Transfer
reviews.title: A very satisfactory hotel

likes.liked: — Close to all sights and shops, very nice breakfast, lounge bar, view from room

reviews.text: The worst part of the experience. When I booked the hotel online, I noted that I would like a hotel transferto pick me at the airport. a week before leaving, I had not received any confirmation of this so I called the hotel direct only to be put on hold for an indeterminate time so I hung up. I then e-mailed the hotel again noting my request for a hotel transfer. The night before flying to Tallinn I still had not received confirmation so I repeated; called....on hold forever, hung-up and sent an e-mail. Of course when I arrived, there was no one waiting. Luckily, the Tallinn airport is well organized and has a proper cab rank which seems strictly controlled. Note to future travellers, just step outside the door into the cab rank, I think it was 130eek to the hotel and we were in some serious traffic, so it's probably usually cheaper.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - well worth a visit

likes.liked: — Location and the bar at the top of the hotel

reviews.text: Check-In/Check-Out
reviews.title: Great Conference Venue

reviews.text: Having no preconcieved notions of what to expect in Tallinn, we pulled up the the SAS and were very impressed.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel
great place to stay
reviews.text: For a city that is coming to life as they embrace the EU, etc this hotel is ready to accept worldwide travellers. The city itself was also a joy to visit, especially Old Town.
The SAS has a very modern feel with great staff & service.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

likes.disliked: — Smoking policy or lack of one

reviews.text: The Skybar on the top floor is a must, with great drinks, service and outdoor seating where you can take in all of Tallinn. The other great feature of this hip bar is the Free WiFi allowing you to finish some work at the end of the day while enjoying a great view & nice drink. For a nightcap order a 'VanaTallinn' which means 'Old Tallinn', and is a nice coffee with the local liqour.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are nice (clean & comfortable) and mine offered a nice view of the city.
reviews.title: Great views!

reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent
What a view!
reviews.text: We had a standard 2 bedroom on the 10th floor, with a view of the new city. The room was about 300 SF, a good size, including a good-sized bathroom. The room was modern and highly functional. It was well-appointed with furniture and lighting, but there were no shelves. There was adequate hangar space, but it was not enclosed.
The bathroom had good countertop space, and the shower (no bath) was good, although the water could splash out of the shower area. There was a laundry string to hang your laundry on.
reviews.title: Near the old town

reviews.text: Service and breakfast were very good.
reviews.title: New, comfortable, fresh! (but ask if the room has working air-co!)

reviews.text: It's been many years since I have stayed in a Radisson, I wasn't disappointed. We caught the tallink ferry from Helsinki and then walked to the hotel, 15 minutes ish. We were able to check in early which was appreciated and were offered a paid business upgrade which included a higher room and breakfast which we declined because buffet breakfasts = over indulging for me! The lobby of the hotel seemed to be under some renovations which caused no inconvenience at all. We went up to our standard room on the 15th floor to be blown away by the view of the old town from our window. Probably the most amazing hotel view I've ever had! The room had been very recently renovated and was very modern and light. I did feel that the curtains needed to be completely block out material though as it was always light outside. Also, no armchairs in the room. Bathroom looked partially renovated, shower adequate 3/5, towels average 2.5/5. Hotel is 10 minutes ish walk from the centre of the old town. Also 15 minutes walk to the bus station for Riga.
reviews.title: very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights here in June 2013. Corner room was lovely on the 11th floor. Views to Old town and harbour. Super breakfast is really super. Service is good.Only thing that annoyed and worried us was 100 degrees hot sauna .Also it could be a little bit more cleanly. We recommend to visit the highest rooftop bar in town.It`s on the 24th floor
reviews.title: Best views in town?

reviews.text: We didn't stay at this hotel, but stopped in for a drink in the afternoon before going back to our cruise ship. The rooftop bar has good service (they provide buzzers on your table to flag a server) and a fun drink menu. But the real reason we went here was for the panoramic view of the city. We could see everything up there from Old Town to our ship. It was worth the trip just for that.
reviews.title: Wow, What a View!
Close to Old Town
reviews.text: We stayed here three nights and enjoyed it a lot. It has Scandinavian modernism so you don't have to worry about outdated anything! Very nice views of Old Town from the bar on the top floor, and not far to walk to the gates of the lower Old Town. The cruise ships tend to get to the upper town, so this is a nice place to hang out. Very good breakfast in the hotel, and a good attached restaurant next door that had super food for reasonable prices.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Radisson Blu Tallinn in May 2013. My personal preference for hotels is clean and modern so this was a perfect fit for me. It seems to have been recently renovated - wood floors, large windows, large flat screen tv. We had a room on the 16th flr with an amazing view of the old town. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was great as well - huge spread and lots of things to choose from. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from old town so was reasonably convenient. Loved it and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed many times in this hotel. Hotel is very nice and modern. Staff is great and willing.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with great location

reviews.text: I`m used to traveling around former-USSR countries. So, my policy about accommodation is simple – you`d better stay at worldwide network hotels.
reviews.title: Choose carefully - Blu, not Olympus

reviews.text: That’s the reason why I chose Radisson in Tallinn (note it, there are two Radissons there, this one - Radisson Blu, and the second - Radisson Olympus, which was built about 30 years ago and has been renovated, so you may consider choosing first one).
reviews.title: Renovated. What a shame.

reviews.text: If you stayed in this network previously – you know what it is about. For those who are new: the rooms are cozy, bathroom is ok, wifi is free, breakfast is good (great selection of meat), staff are friendly, mini-bar is computerized (if you take anything from it, for example to read the label – consider it`s bought).
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: And don`t forget to visit the skybar at the top of the building to see the picturesque view there (also, one little tip – the higher your room is – the greater picture from the window you have).
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Tallinn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Radisson fairly regularly over the past few years, and on this last visit this was recognised with a little tray of tasties in the room, which was nice (see the photo). Unfortunately, that also means I can compare the hotel before and after the renovations which the other reviews are talking about... and I'm sorry to say I liked the room and the restaurant a lot better before they were done.
reviews.title: Good value for money.

reviews.text: Good distance to the area. Can walk anywhere u need. Shopping mall accross street that also has drug store. Bank just next door to obtain Euros. Old Town easy walk. Sky bar had amazing views. Rooms nice, clean and roomy. Breakfast is a huge spread with great choices. Coffee/tea in room. Also mini fridge stocked w items for purchase. Good choice. Very pleased.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I tend to stay away from larger chains, but this came in handy and was a great experience. The hotel is very, very nice, with one of the most comfy beds I've ever met. Short walk (about 10 mins) to Old Town. There's a shopping mall across the street with a great grocery store in the basement. I recommend checking out the deli and fresh foods. There is a bar on the 24th floor with a great view of the city and rooms have great views as well. Hotel has a kiosk where you can check in for your flights. Staff was very nice and helpful. It's right across from the opera house, and also really tall, so it's easy not getting lost...which I tend to get. Breakfast not included.
reviews.title: Great experience, great location
Wonderful stay - highly recommended
reviews.text: I stayed for four nights for a conference and it was fantastic. I was on the 22nd floor with a beautiful view over the old town (ask for a view when you get a room). It was lovely and quiet, well appointed room with toiletries etc. Laundry service was excellent (but pricey). Buffet breakfast was great, busy at times but good. Conference facilities were excellent. The roof top bar is just amazing with its gorgeous views. Easy walk into the old town from the hotel. We had a special conference rate of 105 euro for a business room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed on the sixteenth floor for two nights in May... A clean room with a good view. Approx ten min walk to the old city. The old city is delightful, with lots of places to eat. Beware of pick pockets in the city.
reviews.title: Two night stay

reviews.text: A very good range of food for breakfast and dinner.
reviews.title: Would be almost perfect, if not...

description: Clients can choose between Scandinavian, Oriental, Maritime & Italian room styles - In the city centre of Tallinn.
